definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: Select colors that match or go with neutrals that fit and style .
sentences.chinese: 選擇匹配的顏色，或到與中立國適合和作風。

sentences.english: They thrust a neutral state into war.
sentences.chinese: 他們強把中立國推入戰爭。

sentences.english: The soldier was interned in a neutral country until the war was over.
sentences.chinese: 這些士兵被扣留在中立國直到戰爭結束。

sentences.english: Switzerland is a neutral country in the two world wars.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士在兩次世界大戰中都是中立國家。

sentences.english: The navy is accused of having attacked neutral shipping.
sentences.chinese: 海軍被指控襲擊中立國的船泊。

sentences.english: Some neutral countries, like Switzerland, did not take part in the Second World War.
sentences.chinese: 一些中立國家，像瑞士沒有參加第二次世界大戰。

sentences.english: These soldiers were interned in a neutral country until the war was over.
sentences.chinese: 這些士兵被拘留在中立國，直到戰爭結束。

sentences.english: Norway was a neutral country during World War I.
sentences.chinese: 挪威在第一次世界大戰時期是中立國。

sentences.english: This Statute does not prescribe the rights and duties of belligerentsand neutrals in time of war.
sentences.chinese: 本規約不規範戰時交戰國和中立國的權利和義務。
